item.title: How the Chinese Govt Controls the Media [SoECS]
item.description: Seeing government influence through coordination of sensitive coverage, localization of negative news & crowding out other stories on the front page. Structural topic models (LDA + context, e.g. topic prevalence, choice of words) analyze fundamental aspect of the news that can’t be changed. Instead of assuming news follows events, investigate!

item.title: Lessons Learned in Tech Policy [SoECS]
item.description: Local governments face severe constraints. Liaising with big tech for employees on sabbaticals could alleviate this. State legislators may have unfounded opinions, but they have the sway, so work with them. Rural-urban differences. Rural folk were more active. Urban folks wrote angry blogs and that was it.

item.title: Google's Project Dragonfly [The Intercept]
item.description: Google Plans to Launch Censored Search Engine in China, Leaked Documents Reveal [The Intercept]. Ryan Gallagher. The Intercept. https://theintercept.com/2018/08/01/google-china-search-engine-censorship/ . Aug 1, 2018. Project Dragonfly A censored version of Google search that blacklists websites and search terms about human rights, democracy, religion and peaceful protests. China has 750m people; 80% of its internet access is on Android. There’s $$$ to be made. Between 2006 and 2010, Google had maintained a censored Google Search, but was heavily criticized.

item.title: Cambridge Analytica Uncovered: Secret filming reveals election tricks [Channel 4]
item.description: Cambridge Analytica Uncovered: Secret filming reveals election tricks. Channel 4 News. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mpbeOCKZFfQ . Mar 19, 2018. Pay people to take surveys but through an app. Mine their profile data, and also crawl their friends. Identify swayable voters and their sensitivities. Craft targeted ads. Play on (unconscious) fears and hopes. Elections are about emotions, not facts. Data science and social media can help us make sense of and manipulate the chaos.

item.title: So You Want to Reform Democracy [Medium]
item.description: So You Want to Reform Democracy. Joshua Tauberer. https://medium.com/civic-tech-thoughts-from-joshdata/so-you-want-to-reform-democracy-7f3b1ef10597 . Nov 22, 2015. If there was an idea that could ‘fix’ democracy, it would have been thought-up already. If you don’t see your idea out there, it’s because it didn’t work the hundreds of other times someone tried it. Let’s tell representatives what their constituents think. Then they HAVE to vote with us! They don’t necessarily want to know what their constituents are thinking.
